abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is assessed as
            unsatisfactory: the project met only a limited part of its
            objectives. Most project components were either transferred
            to other new projects or substantially modified during the
            course of implementation. In terms of sustainability of the
            limited activities carried out by the project, it is likely
            that most will be sustainable. Overall World Bank
            performance has been partially satisfactory and would have
            been rated deficient had it not been for IDA's
            pro-activity in designing and implementing new and
            comprehensive programs in some areas, its achievements in
            introducing policy reform measures, and the relatively
            satisfactory work done in the few areas where the project
            was implemented. The main lessons drawn include the
            following: The lack of an inter-ministerial coordinating
            body in which all of the implementing agencies are
            represented was one of the main causes for the
            project's poor implementation. Unilateral closing of a
            project component as experienced with the line of credit is
            not advisable since it tends to cause participating
            commercial banks and Borrowers alike to lose confidence in
            institutions. The project also suffered from unsatisfactory
            management on the part of the ministries involved and lacked
            continuity in project management and supervision on the part
            of the Bank. Neglect in setting up the monitoring and
            evaluation system as envisaged resulted in poor assessment
            of implementation progress and hindered impact assessment.
